data.text:
"Our community completely saved us"

A Toronto bar owner says her business will survive the coronavirus pandemic thanks to the loyal customers who bought up her entire beer stock, giving her a desperately needed cash boost https://t.co/3D45vlnVD3
"The Lord of the Rings" cast is crowdfunding to buy J.R.R. Tolkien's home in Oxford, England, and turn it into a literary center. https://t.co/1mYm8ipAT0

While many Republican senators have not publicly acknowledged him as the President-elect, Joe Biden says "more than several" sitting GOP senators have privately called to congratulate him: "I understand the situation they find themselves in." https://t.co/A2oWZYiEFz https://t.co/caLhAax3Ji

North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper is calling on the Trump administration to lead on mask wearing in order to help mitigate the spread of Covid-19.

“When you have a leader in the White House that’s encouraging people not to obey the rules, that causes significant problems for us.” https://t.co/t3RKmN2dvH

Former Presidents Barack Obama, George W. Bush and Bill Clinton are volunteering to get their Covid-19 vaccines on camera to promote public confidence in the vaccine's safety once the US Food and Drug Administration authorizes one https://t.co/kvsArqwYgC

Rick Bright, the former director of a key federal vaccine agency, says Americans hosting holiday parties despite a surge in coronavirus cases “is extremely concerning.”

“I would encourage anyone who is considering attending those events to think twice,” he added. https://t.co/6OsXQ2OAeN

Rep. Karen Bass says the Congressional Black Caucus has been in communication with the incoming Biden administration.

"We have set up a task force that is looking at appointments, that is looking at areas of policy for the first 100 days and we are making recommendations." https://t.co/5rj5o0WTfs

"The protocol of the transfer of power, I think, is important. But it is totally his decision, and it's of no personal consequence to me. But I do think it is for the country," Biden said on whether President Trump will choose to attend his inauguration https://t.co/F133uwDdFq

Pres. Trump claimed we have found "massive fraud" in Arizona, days after the state certified President-elect Biden's win.

 "We have not found any evidence of fraud here in our state," says Arizona's Secretary of State Katie Hobbs. "...No, I do not know what he is talking about." https://t.co/CWVY8McG4D

As coronavirus cases surge across the nation, Dr. Chris Murray, researcher behind an influential coronavirus model from the University of Washington, says "we have some dark months ahead." https://t.co/Vf8PX3Yfsr https://t.co/vnLsvjhTsm

A record-setting hurricane season just ended. Here’s what scientists are most confident is happening to hurricanes as a result of climate change, what they think might be occurring and the biggest questions about how these massive storms are changing. https://t.co/1Gnccxymvg

“I’ve been doing this work for more than 30 years and it’s never been at this level of need,” says Michael Flood, president and CEO of the Los Angeles Regional Food Bank about the increase in the number of Americans flocking to food lines amid the pandemic. https://t.co/nuT9vnKQrG

Wuhan, the Chinese city once at the epicenter of the coronavirus pandemic, has launched a new promotional video as part of attempts to lure travelers to see the beauty of the city. But its footage has left netizens divided. https://t.co/e9alfkNjv2
The Trump administration has sued Facebook for allegedly passing over US job candidates for thousands of positions in favor of immigrant workers holding temporary visas https://t.co/07SMF4k6Dk

China this week revealed plans to drastically expand an experimental weather modification program to cover an area of over 5.5 million square kilometers (2.1 million square miles) — more than 1.5 times the total size of India https://t.co/3ee3q8WzUE
Blackpink's first livestream concert will include performances of songs from "The Album," which the group released in October. https://t.co/huH7M6AdpS
The Trump administration sued Facebook for allegedly passing over US job candidates for thousands of positions in favor of immigrant workers holding temporary visas https://t.co/dFaOwG35vq
Millions of Californians may soon find themselves under stay home orders once again due to new restrictions announced by Gov. Gavin Newsom https://t.co/POgVCXhXdV

The 2017 travel ban imposed by the Trump administration on seven Muslim-majority countries may be associated with an increase in preterm births among women from those countries residing in the United States, according to a new study https://t.co/lSM0mrSC3e

Hundreds of Rohingya refugees in Bangladesh are being relocated to a controversial island facility in the Bay of Bengal this week amid fears that some could be forced to move there and held indefinitely https://t.co/foOF493jlm

"One of Donald Trump's services to history will be to underscore just how much the integrity of the presidency depends on the character of its incumbent," writes @StCollinson | Analysis https://t.co/G1JwCYDgq8

President-elect Joe Biden has revealed that "more than several" Republican senators have called to privately congratulate him on his election win, despite the fact that most of them have not publicly acknowledged his victory last month https://t.co/5qhGLiQOml

Here’s the card you’ll get when you eventually get the Covid-19 vaccine.

Everyone will get a card "they can put in their wallet that will tell them what they had and when their next dose is due," says Dr. Kelly Moore of the Immunization Action Coalition. https://t.co/2cxL2yEvwl https://t.co/UqCTOoVldZ

President-elect Joe Biden says he's concerned about reports that President Trump is considering a host of preemptive pardons for his adult children and lawyer Rudy Giuliani, as well as the possibility of one for himself https://t.co/Hg0dpdtEtG

"I'm determined and I'm confident," President-elect Joe Biden tells @jaketapper, describing his emotions as he prepares to begin his presidency. "...We have to restore the soul of this nation." https://t.co/2VDBo0Lafz https://t.co/31z1Ucv2r3

"The protocol of the transfer of power, I think, is important. But it is totally his decision, and it's of no personal consequence to me. But I do think it is for the country," Biden said on whether President Trump will choose to attend his inauguration https://t.co/FkPEj6x140

Vice President-elect Kamala Harris acknowledges the challenges awaiting the administration’s climate plan: "Our agenda is pretty progressive. And some might call it ambitious. But we the American people, and frankly the world, can't afford anything less." https://t.co/o9tBctF74v https://t.co/TjH5ig8hYh

While many Republican senators have not publicly acknowledged him as the President-elect, Joe Biden says "more than several" sitting GOP senators have privately called to congratulate him: "I understand the situation they find themselves in." https://t.co/09EtvTf1GG https://t.co/72ex6eFY8F

Biden, facing increasing pressure to appoint Black and Latino nominees to remaining high-level Cabinet posts: "I'm going to keep my commitment that the administration, both in the White House and outside in the Cabinet, is going to look like the country." https://t.co/eibxlCe71o https://t.co/j4nBnusalg
